Structural properties

This function collects structural properties such as mass, size and height of the HI disk. It might be interesting to see how they relate to the dynamical properties of the galaxies.

structural_properties.HI_disk_height(xyz, m_HI, R_halfmass, frac=0.9)

Calculates the height of the disk vertically enclosing the specified fraction of the HI mass within one halfmass radius.

Parameters

  • xyz – array of dimension 3xN containing gas particle positions.

  • m_HI – array of dimension 1xN containing HI masses.

  • R_halfmass – halfmass radius of the galaxy

  • frac – mass fraction to be enclosed. Default is 0.9

structural_properties.HI_disk_size(xyz, m, frac=0.9)

Calculates the radius enclosing the specified fraction of the HI mass.

Parameters

  • xyz – array of dimension 3xN containing gas particle positions.

  • m_HI – array of dimension 1xN containing HI masses.

  • frac – mass fraction to be enclosed. Default is 0.9
